moves.2... e6: not sure, maybe just wanted to get his queen out. Loses the knight as a result
moves.4. f3: Prevents a Scholars Mate, which might have been the aim.
moves.4... g6: allowing the bishop through either way, but makes an attack up the black diag very tempting...
moves.5. Nc3: Knight blocks the queen taking the rook when I B3
moves.6. b3: now I get the bishop to threaten
moves.7... b6 8. Na4:
If he hadn't castled, I would have been guaranteed a high-value piece. now I'm just threatening the queen...
Note the knight moving and guarding in one...
moves.8... Bb7: However, he didn't see the bishop, and so...
moves.9. Bxf6: I get his queen at no Loss!
moves.9... Bc6: Bishop threatening the knight, a very roundabout route
moves.10. Nh3: Developing and giving the potential to castle...
moves.10... Bg7: Forcing me to exchange or lose the rook..
moves.13... Na6: again, the 'Passive' Bishop gets a kill
moves.14. Bxa6: no covering pieces means the bishop is free
moves.14... Rae8 15. c4 e5 16. Bb5 a6: Piece Exchange: I'm ahead and so am perfectly willing.
moves.18... bxc5 19. Nxc5 e4 20. f4: If I took, he would have taken me with the pawn, then if the knight takes then I lose out to the castle. therefore, I move to safety.
moves.21. Ng5 e2: Honestly Didn't expect that move. A Brilliant move, I think.
moves.22. Qe1 Re7: no Idea... specially since he could have got the rook in exchange for a pawn.
moves.23. Nce6+: The start of the rampage. Here, I get a Rook
moves.24. Nxf8 c5 25. Ngxh7+: Check, and guarded by the other knight
moves.25... Kf7 26. Ne6: White Moves his knight, seemingly making a Mistake and leaving it unguarded
moves.27. Ng5+: and the other Knight gets the rook!
moves.27... Kf6: but the king guards just as well...
moves.28. Nxe6 Kxe6: I made a chess puzzle from this point onwards.
moves.29... Kf6 30. Rae1 a5: my guess is he thought I would go to E6, leaving him safe from checkmate...
moves.31. Qe7#: but I have a different plan!
